registry.title: IS-IS TLV Codepoints
registry.note: For IS-IS registries and value ranges maintained via the "Expert Review" registration procedure, guidance for IESG-designated experts can be found in .

registry.title: TLV Codepoints Registry
registry.expert: Chris Hopps, Hannes Gredler, Les Ginsberg
registry.note: IETF SHALL keep JTC1/SC6 informed of TLV codepoint values allocated, and JTC1/SC6 SHALL refer allocation requests arising within JTC1 constituencies to the IANA registry process.
Codepoints greater than 255 can only be used in PDUs designated to support extended TLVs.

registry.title: Sub-TLVs for TLVs 22, 23, 25, 141, 222, and 223 (Extended IS reachability, IS Neighbor Attribute, L2 Bundle Member Attributes, inter-AS reachability information, MT-ISN, and MT IS Neighbor Attribute TLVs)
registry.expert: Chris Hopps, Hannes Gredler, Les Ginsberg
registry.note: Allocations within this registry require documentation of the use of the allocated value and approval by the Designated Expert assigned by the IESG.

The column for TLV 25 may be marked as follows:
y - sub-TLV may appear in TLV 25 but MUST NOT be shared by multiple L2 Bundle Members y(s) - sub-TLV may appear in TLV 25 and MAY be shared by multiple L2 Bundle Members n - sub-TLV MUST NOT appear in TLV 25
